step.text: Push the button to turn on the power supplies.
Find the lamp bulb block, the wire block, and the switch block.
Connect them in a circuit with the DC Power Supply like this.
Turn the lamp on and off by using the switch.
Once you’ve made the lamp turn off and on, try taking the lamp away and putting the DC motor in its place. Can you get it to turn on and off?

explanation.text:
Electrical components won’t work unless you put them in a circuit. You need to provide an electrical path into and out of each component.

In this circuit, when the switch is closed (ON), electricity leaves the power supply, flows through the switch, flows through the wire, flows through the lamp and lights it up, and flows back to the power supply.

If you open the switch (turn it OFF), electricity can’t flow through any part of the circuit and the lamp won’t light.
